title: Business models for three selected best-bet interventions for small ruminant value chains in Ethiopia
narrative: Business models were developed for three best-bet interventions, namely sheep fattening, ram selection and market information system. The best -bet interventions were identified, tested and recommended for selected small ruminant value chains in Ethiopia. The models provide initial ideas for interested businesses and researchers on the potential of the best-bets as business interventions in the sites for up to four years.

title: WABEF, a toolkit to promote anaerobic digestion of bio-wastes in West Africa
narrative: WABEF is a compendium of data sheets and databases (3) to estimate the wastes from agricultural activities, municipal activities, and ago-industrial activities. It suggests anaerobic digestion technologies to use up these bio-wastes. It uses a simulation model (Approzut and UPUTUC simulation) to compare the mass balances and assess the investment and operating costs of these technologies to support decision making by governments, communities, industries and farmers.

title: Nicaragua dairy systems dynamics model – public facing aspect
narrative: This project developed a quantitative model of the dairy value chain in the district of Matiguas in Nicaragua. Two particular innovations from this work were (1) the use of participatory group model building tools in developing/parameterizing this model with dairy value chain stakeholders and (2) hosting the parameterized model with a public interface online, allowing interested parties to conduct simulations under alternative technical parameter assumptions

title: "Reach, Benefit, Empower" framework of indicators for monitoring programs and policies
narrative:
"Johnson, N., M. Balagamwala, C. Pinkstaff, S. Theis, R. Meinzen-Dick, and A. Quisumbing.  2018.  How do agricultural development projects empower women? What hasn’t worked and what might.  Journal of Agriculture, Gender, and Food Security 3(2):1-19. http://agrigender.net/views/agricultural-development-projects-empowering-women-JGAFS-322018-1.php 

https://www.rural21.com/english/current-issue/detail/article/doing-things-differently-gender-transformative-skills-development-in-agriculture-00002938/ (GIZ’s use)

http://tropicallegumes.icrisat.org/misuse-of-the-term-empowerment-in-daily-conversations/ (blog post Brenda shared today)"

title: Involving the private sector to improve the multiplication and marketing of high quality seed: the Direct Seed Marketing program in Ethiopia
narrative: The evaluation compared the Direct Seed Marketing approach to the traditional government-managed system, and found that this system leads to positive outcomes. The study concluded that the increased engagement by private seed producers in the provision of improved seeds to Ethiopia's smallholder farmers is a useful and necessary element in the transformation of Ethiopia?s agricultural sector.

title: Zoonoses training manual for slaughterhouse workers
narrative: Booklets containing simple public health messages to reduce health risks for slaughterhouse workers and consumers.

title: Pen-side diagnostic assay for cysticercosis
narrative: A diagnostic tool farmers or meat inspectors could use to detect Taenia solium cyst infections (cysticercosis) in pigs to prevent entry of contaminated pork in the food chain.

title: [updated from 2017] Vicious Worm training app for cysticercosis control
narrative: Health-education tool ‘The Vicious Worm’ creates awareness and provides evidence-based health education as a specific measure in control strategies.

title: SMART-Valleys approach
narrative: Participatory approach to develop inland valleys (IVs) for rice-based systems with improved water management

title: RiceAdvice
narrative: Android based decision support tools for providing farmers with field-specific management guidelines for rice production systems in Africa

title: Two-row Motorized Paddy Weeder
narrative: Locally adopted two-row Motorized Paddy Weeder developed in collaboration with private fabricators. The weeder can be used in irrigated and rainfed lowland systems and can save labour for weeding up to 80%.

title: Seeder cum fertiliser micro-dose applicator (Fertiseeder)
narrative: A manual seeder cum fertilizer micro-dose applicator (Fertiseeder) developed to save labor in direct seeding and micro-dose placement.

title: Cropping calendar construction model
narrative: Excel-based decision support tool that can generate, compare and visualise opportunities for single/double/triple cropping systems consisting of irrigated rice and optionally a vegetable/legumes

title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD) in Africa
narrative: Alternate wetting and drying is a water saving technology that enables irrigated rice cultivation with less water than the conventional practice of maintaining the field continuously flooded. Under AWD, ﬁelds are subjected to intermittent ﬂooding where irrigation is interrupted, and water is allowed to subside until the soil reaches a certain moisture level, after which the field is re-flooded. It has been reported that this technology can reduce water input and GHG without yield penalty.

title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD) in Asia
narrative: Alternate wetting and drying is a water saving technology that enables irrigated rice cultivation with less water than the conventional practice of maintaining the field continuously flooded. Under AWD, ﬁelds are subjected to intermittent ﬂooding where irrigation is interrupted, and water is allowed to subside until the soil reaches a certain moisture level, after which the field is re-flooded. It has been reported that this technology can reduce water input and GHG without yield penalty.

title: Weather-rice-nutrient integrated decision support system (WeRise)
narrative: WeRise is a seasonal climate prediction-based decision support system for rainfed rice farmers through integration of statistical downscaling model of GCM and crop growth model. WeRise provides an optimum variety, and timing for sowing and fertilizer application which are key information to deal with yield increase in rainfed.

title: Field Calculator
narrative: Field Calculator (FC) is a decision support tool for sustainable rice production. The Field Calculator is a web-based application for data collection and impact assessment of inputs and practices in rice production with the aim to provide insights and options for optimization towards sustainability. Functionality of FC: (1) collect day-to-day farmer rice crop management information and (2) calculate SRP standard scores and performance indicators for use by CORIGAP NARES partners and SRP adopters

title: Rice Crop Manager
narrative: RCM is a decision-support tool designed for use by extension workers, crop advisors, agricultural service providers, and farmer leaders. It is accessible online on personal computers, tablets, or smartphones.

title: Rice Doctor Odiya
narrative: Rice Doctor Odiya is a mid-season interactive diagnostic tool in local language that aims to help extension agents, students, researchers and farmers of Odisha to identify, have accurate and timely diagnosis or at least make a short list of more than 80 possible crop pest and disease problems that can occur in all growth stages of rice throughout the state of Odisha and provide actionable advice as recommendations on their management.

title: Sustainable Rice Platform (SRP) Standard and Performance Indicators
narrative: SRP Performance Indicators are designed to assess sustainability improvements resulting from changes in farm practice, and include profitability, labor and land productivity, food safety, resource use efficiency, climate change mitigation, labor conditions, and women empowerment. The Standard defines a set of key requirements with different levels of performance allowing for a stepwise improvement and compliance process

title: AutoMonPH- a decision tool for system level water management using AWD principle
narrative: A decision tool for catalyzing the adoption of water-saving technologies by improving access to information, effective coordination among stakeholders, and transparency in water governance

title: Improved water governance
narrative: Improved water governance to unlock the production potential in polders of the coastal zone of Bangladesh
evidence_link: Sudhir-Yadav, M. Mondal, A. Shew, S.V.K. Jagadish, Z.H. Khan, A. Sutradhar, H. Bhandari, E. Humphreys, J. Bhattacharya, R. Parvin, M. Rahman, P. Chandna. Making inroads to intensify agricultural productivity in the polders of the coastal zone of Bangladesh. Paper submitted to Water Resource Management on Jan 4, 2019.

title: EasyHarvest: Web based tool for linking farmers with harvesting contract service providers
narrative: Web based tool for linking farmers with harvesting contract service providers / combine harvester operators for scheduling harvesting operations, matching field conditions with available machine types and optimizing the scheduling.

title: Laser land leveling in Cambodia, Vietnam, Thailand
narrative: Precision land leveling using a stationary laser plane at the side of the field, a 4-wheel tractor pulled drag bucket equipped with a receiver, control box and hydraulics to keep the drag bucket at the same height with reference to the laser plane. Laser leveling allows field leveling with +/-1cm accuracy and leads to water savings (40-60%), increased yields 10-20%, better weed control and can also be used for field consolidation for improved mechanization.

title: Laser land leveling in Indonesia, Philippines, Myanmar, Sri Lanka
narrative: Precision land leveling using a stationary laser plane at the side of the field, a 4-wheel tractor pulled drag bucket equipped with a receiver, control box and hydraulics to keep the drag bucket at the same height with reference to the laser plane. Laser leveling allows field leveling with +/-1cm accuracy and leads to water savings (40-60%), increased yields 10-20%, better weed control and can also be used for field consolidation for improved mechanization.

title: Bio-diversified upland rice based cropping systems designing
narrative: A set of multi-year experiments contributed as a decision tool for extension service and farmers to improve fertility and pest management of upland rice based cropping systems.

title: SeedCast mobile app
narrative: Innovative mobile app to estimate seed demand for rice varieties in Odisha, India. SeedCast will help estimate demand for varieties of rice seeds, which makes nearly 80% of the Kharif cultivation. This information made available to seed corporations, will help them produce the preferred seeds, in the required quantities, so gaps between supply and demand of rice seed varieties can be narrowed.  This will in turn encourage the replacement of older, lesser-yielding varieties of rice.

title: Semi automatic rice husk furnace
narrative: A 'downdraft rice husk furnace' developed for paddy drying that resulted in an improved air-cooled grate with optimal operation to generate sufficient heat to increase the drying air temperature by 10–15 °C at an air flow rate of 3.5 m3 s−1, attaining an efficiency of 80%.

title: Novel training and business model for linking farmers to markets for sustainable rice production
narrative: The 2-week Rice: Post-production to Market introduces participants from all sectors, including research, extension, NGOs and private sector representatives, to critical issues and challenges in reducing postproduction losses.

title: Rice straw pelletizing
narrative: Technology to produce compressed bales and pellets, which are later used for animal feed

title: Novel rice straw mushroom production Business Models (Training Manual)
narrative: Technology for using rice straw to safely grow mushrooms, and the associated business models and training material as package for uptake

title: Anaerobic digestion of rice straw, household batch system
narrative:
Anaerobic digestion (AD), is a biological process that can degrade waste organic material by the concerted action of a wide range of microorganisms in the absence of oxygen. The process converts a large portion of rice straw into biogas, which is typically a mixture of
methane (60%) and carbon dioxide (40%). If captured, biogas can be utilized as a clean fuel for heat and power generation.

title: A novel combination of the 'adaptive research' methodology with the Learning Alliance approach
narrative: A novel combination of the 'adaptive research' methodology with the Learning Alliance approach to bridge the gap between farmers and researchers, to expand the number of stakeholders with whom farmers interact., with the ultimate objective of scaling out solutions to improved farmers livelihoods.

title: Training Module: Life Cycle Assessment for Agriculture
narrative: Training courseware on sustainability analysis and best practice identification based on Life Cycle Assessment

title: Vocational training program for Agricultural Machinery Mechanics
narrative: Various institutions from the Government and development projects are providing technical innovations like rice seeders, fertilizer spreaders, land leveling equipment, mechanical weeding, and equipment for grain and seed cleaning but often lack capacity for integration and 'delivery'. Value chain support services like after sales service provision or financing are only rudimentarily developed.   To increase Cambodia’s innovation system capacity IRRI and Don Bosco in Battambang developed a vocational training program for Agricultural Machinery Mechanics.

title: IRRI Rice Quality Kit
narrative: The IRRI Rice Quality Assessment Kit consists of a set of various tools that help measuring one or several paddy, milled rice or seed quality traits. It is intended to be used in postharvest and other quality related training courses but several of the kits have already been purchased by millers and other value chain actors to help them in their daily tasks too

title: Evaluation of Common Application System for Anganwadi Workers in India
narrative:
A mobile and web-based application that is designed to help the Anganwadi Workers deliver services effectively and efficiently.
At the supervisory level, it provides a combination of mobile and web-based applications and dashboards, making real time information available on service delivery and beneficiary nutrition status at the sector, block, district, state and national level. The goal is to improve management and facilitate early identification of gaps for informed decision making and timely actions.

title: Measuring coverage of nutrition counselling interventions: Leveraging available data and program experiences
narrative: Data Notes focus on data visualization to highlight the geographic distribution and/or thematic issues related to nutrition in India. They draw on multiple sources of publicly available data.

title: Launched a collection of outputs on how to design nutrition-sensitive value chain (NSVC) projects
narrative: Guides for project design, produced to fill a key knowledge gap in the emerging field of value chains for nutrition by providing guidance on how to design nutrition-sensitive value chain (NSVC) projects, with a particular focus on smallholder producers. This guide is relevant not only for IFAD but also for development actors in general, and for organizations working in agriculture and rural development in particular.

title: Mainstreaming behavior change communications into agricultural projects in Uganda
narrative: First attempt to substantiate recommendations from nutrition technical advisors at the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) to integrate social and behavior change communications (SBCC) into IFAD-funded projects.

title: New methods for identifying and analyzing constraints to greater consumption of animal-sourced foods, including measuring of affordability constraints, methods to analyze causes of high prices of nutritious foods.
narrative: A series of studies on the affordability of nutritious foods, especially animal sourced foods. Includes a series of methods for measuring and analyzing affordability and its constraints, including relative price measures, price decompositions and economywide simulation analyses.

title: Pro-WEAI (project-level Women's Empowerment in Agriculture Index)
narrative: The pro-WEAI is a survey-based index that builds on the Women’s Empowerment in Agriculture Index (WEAI) and is adapted for project use with a closer focus on aspects of empowerment related to health and nutrition.

title: Architecture for a tool matrix on methodologies for implementation to support Scaling up Nutrition (SUN) countries
narrative: Tool matrix aims to help address questions around: creating and/or strengthening global and national networks for implementation knowledge; knowledge brokering, which helps make scientific and contextual information more accessible to implementers and policy makers; creating country-specific tools to strengthen implementation of nutrition actions; and building capacity, support and funding for impactful research on implementation.

title: Evidence on how to leverage neglected and underutilized species (NUS) to improve nutrition
narrative: Evidence summary to demonstrate how effective conservation and use of neglected and underutilized species (NUS) improve food and nutrition security with special attention to youths, adolescent girls and young mothers, strengthen adaptation to climate change and support empowerment of the poor and vulnerable groups to come out of poverty and social marginalization.

title: How to harness the nutrition co-benefits of climate resilient agriculture
narrative: Report describing how investments in climate-resilient agriculture can be leveraged not only to deliver benefits to secure food security under a changing climate, but also to contribute to efforts to eradicate malnutrition.

title: Community-based early childhood development centers as a platform to promote as a platform to promote production and consumption diversity in Malawi
narrative: The Nutrition Embedded Evaluation Program Impact Evaluation (NEEP-IE) used a cluster-RCT design to examine the effectiveness of using a community-based ECD center as a platform in Malawi to promote household production and consumption diversity, improve caregiver knowledge and practices of nutrition and infant and young child feeding (IYCF) practices, and improve diets and nutrition among preschoolers and their younger siblings

title: Implementation of drone HTP phenotyping in multiple sites globally
narrative: Dissemination of drone-base technologies in multiple countries, resulting in a dataset to assist breeding for climate resilient varieties globally.

title: Development of mechanisms to reduce market distortions in Ethiopian small ruminant value chains
narrative: Development and policy options to minimise policy-induced price distortions in markets for small ruminants

title: Targeting agricultural policies and interventions to serve multiple stakeholder goals: A new modeling approach using Bayesian Network models
narrative: Holistic probability modeling approach using Bayesian Network models combined with participatory engagement to identify how to make agricultural policies and interventions more nutrition-sensitive

title: Satellite-based rice monitoring system in India and the Philippines
narrative: A satellite-based rice monitoring system that provides seasonal estimates of rice area and yield, and assessment of crop loss in the event of flood or drought

title: satellite-based rice monitoring system in Cambodia and Vietnam
narrative: A satellite-based rice monitoring system that provides seasonal estimates of rice area and yield, and assessment of crop loss in the event of flood or drought

title: Flood-tolerant rice varieties for Bangladesh (sub1)
narrative:
The Bangladesh Rice Research Institute (BRRI) and the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (BINA), in collaboration with the International Rice Research Institute (IRRI), have already developed and promoted five Sub1 rice varieties, BRRI dhan51, BRRI dhan52, BRRI dhan79, BINA Dhan 11, and BINA Dhan 12, which are suitable for farming in the Aman season (July-November).  
The main attribute of Sub1 rice varieties is that they can survive at least 7-14 days under water.

title: Premium Quality Rice (PQR) varieties BRRI Dhan 50 and BRRI Dhan 63
narrative: New rice varieties released by the Bangladesh Rice Research Institute

title: '1 Must 5 Reductions (1M5R)' integrated rice management package
narrative: 1M5R or ‘Mot Phai, Nam Giam’ is certified by a Presidential decree (532-QD-TT-CLT) as the national policy to promote best management practices in lowland rice cultivation. The focus of 1M5R is to use good-quality seeds (the one must do) and to reduce seed rates, pesticide use, fertilizer inputs, water use, and postharvest losses.

title: Array sites established in multiple locations in India, Southeast Asia, Latin America, and Africa
narrative: Network of partners evaluating the same genetic population across 25 sites covering high yielding or climate vulnerable areas.Reference panel in the global array (Magic indica Panel of 358 lines) was evaluated in Africa (Senegal and Cote d’Ivoire), Colombia (Palmira), Raipur (India), Yezin (Myanmar), Los Banos and Iloilo (Philippines) under irrigated conditions.

title: MINCER micrometerological station used to improve spikelet sterility estimations in crop models
narrative: Tools were developed for the adaptation of crop models to improve rice spikelet sterility induced by extreme temperatures.  A radiation-shielded, solar-powered, force-ventilated system that is designed to facilitate its use by researchers to  accurately measure the thermal environment within the canopy.

title: Rice biomass software for drone image analysis
narrative: Software for easy image analysis and estimation of aerial biomass

title: Hoja blanca disease screening system
narrative: HTP drone system for rice hoja blanca virus field screening

title: Molecular marker for blast resistance in West Africa
narrative: Markers validated to screen for blast resistance in West Africa

title: Rice yellow mottle virus (RYMV) resistance-breaking risk map for Africa
narrative: Resistance – breaking risk map for Africa generated to guide the deployment of new resistant RYMV rice varieties.

title: A diagnostic multiplex PCR scheme for identification of plant-associated bacteria of the genus Pantoea
narrative: A new low-cost growth medium has been developed and was demonstrated to only allow the growth of all Pantoea species while it inhibits that of other bacteria and fungi. This selective medium will help diagnose these bacteria in less-equipped labs in the developing world.

title: Pathotracer, a platform to take informed-decision on rice diseases
narrative: A pilot platform to make informed-decision or rice diseases that will allow integration of disease monitoring and breeding interventions

title: Application of AMMI model to multi-site data allowed exploration of G x E effects in GWAS.
narrative: Use of MultiEnvironmental-AMMI with GWAS for G x E

title: Prototype Data Hub
narrative: The Data Hub intends to provide open access to phenotypic and genotypic information and data analysis tools to global users

title: Business-to-business fora to boost livestock trade in Northern Kenya
narrative: Livestock trade facilitation (business-to-business) fora were held in five Kenyan counties (Garissa, Isiolo, Marsabit, Turkana and Wajir) aimed at promoting more efficient trade between livestock buyers and sellers. The fora provided an accessible trading platform for producers and traders who source livestock from various countries such as Ethiopia and Somalia. Supporting pastoralists in ASALs builds resiliency and improves market access to better prices thereby enhancing the region’s food security outlook.

title: Integrated and participatory nutrition and food safety risk assessment for wet markets
narrative: The rapid integrated assessment (RIA) looks explicitly at both food safety and nutritional risks to get an understanding of trade-offs in the informal value chains with a focus on major constraints to increasing production of a specific animal source food, along with characterising the production and consumption patterns and identifying factors influencing its availability and safety, and describing linkages between nutritional and food safety outcomes.

title: Novel genomic regions and donors for grain zinc content
narrative: Novel genomic regions and donors for grain zinc content

title: Early-maturity loci introgression
narrative: Early-maturity loci introgression

title: C4 Rice
narrative: Rice with C4 photosynthesis

title: Multiline variety for blast resistance
narrative: Near isogeneic line’s set for blast resistance genes with IR 64 genetic background, for irrigated lowlands in Africa and Asia

title: Species diagnostic Single Nucleotide Polymorphism markers for quality control genotyping in four rice (Oryza L.) species
narrative: Species diagnostic SNP markers for quality control genotyping in four rice (Oryza L.) species

title: Haplotype-specific markers for use in parental selection
narrative: Assessment of Genetic Variation and Population Structure of Diverse Rice Genotypes Adapted to Lowland and Upland Ecologies in Africa Using SNPs

title: New Quantitative Trait Loci/genes for the control of rice hoja blanca virus disease in Latin America
narrative: Identification and use of new QTLs/genes for the control of rice hoja blanca virus disease in Latin America

title: Improved rice lines with high Zinc concentrations
narrative: Improved rice lines with high Zinc concentrations

title: Rice lines with improved water use efficiency and nitrogen use efficiency
narrative: Rice lines with improved water use efficiency and nitrogen use efficiency

title: 108 Green Super Rice lines tested and available for release, or just formally released, as varieties in Africa and Asia
narrative: Green super rice (GSR) is defined as rice cultivars (inbreds, hybrids) that can produce high and stable yield under less input. 108 Green Super Rice lines tested and available for release, or just formally released, as varieties in Africa and Asia.

title: 246 sequenced African rice genomes
narrative: Sequencing of 246 African rice genomes, 163 domestic and 83 wild.

title: Framework for cost-effectiveness analysis of aflatoxin reduction
narrative: Compared the impacts of two interventions: 1) subsidies for technologies that improve food safety and 2) price premiums for safer produce. We examine the case of on-farm control of aflatoxin, a carcinogenic toxin linked to child stunting that is produced by a fungus commonly found on maize and groundnut

title: Use of nudges to improve food safety
narrative: Based on the nudge theory, ‘nudges’ are interventions with a low level of intrusiveness on personal choice that can be used to alter the behaviour of people, in this case value chain actors in the pork value chain.

title: VegMeasure® computerized vegetation measurement program
narrative: VegMeasure® is a computerized vegetation measurement program which enables users to estimate vegetation (grasslands, forages) parameters and to monitor changes at a minimum cost and in a nondestructive manner.

title: Molecular markers for barley breeding
narrative: Molecular markers for important feed/forage traits for potential use in barley breeding

title: New feed resource technologies in Tunisia
narrative: Two new technologies developed: "silage in bags" and "feed blocks".

title: Module on the implementation of different livestock extension approaches in Tunisia
narrative: Four different extension methods were tested using the RCT (Randomized Control Trials) approach to test their impact on the adoption of agricultural innovations like new barley variety and feed blocks. The extension methods cover technical, organizational and economical training, sending of SMS, field visits and specific female empowerment activities.

title: Rights actualization model for a land tenure diagnostic to assess forest restoration opportunities
narrative: A rights actualization framework is proposed for strengthening tenure analyses in future assessments. Although developed in the context of forest landscape restoration, this approach should have broad utility for other land use initiatives where tenure rights and security are at stake.

title: A River Health Monitoring Framework for Myanmar: Methods and Tools
narrative: P518 developed a method for assessing river health (Myanmar Healthy Rivers Initiatives, MHRI). This method was applied to 2 rivers (Ayeyarwady and Thanlwin) to variables such as: flow stress, biodiversity indicators, water quality results based on magnitudes of different threats, and etc.

title: Redesigned soil health cards for Indian farmers
narrative: India’s Ministry of Agriculture is implementing an $86 million Soil Health Card Scheme to provide nutrient recommendations to farmers based on local soil health tests. Soil health cards containing recommendations to improve management practices based on local soil measures are provided to farmers at two-year intervals. PIM helped re-design these cards to improve their effectiveness, and the new design is already used by Bihar Agricultural University.

title: A Mobile Phone App that will provide more than half of Indian farmers with crop insurance in the next 2-3 years.
narrative: Relying on satellite and climate data, combined with field data on crop yields, AgRISE delivers a crop health card, which enables insurers and government agencies to estimate crop damage and overall insured losses quickly and reliably for all of India’s major crops. Based on the latest geospatial technology (Google Earth Engine and Open Data Kit for field data collection), the tool will strengthen the implementation of PMFBY, reducing costs and facilitating the whole process.

title: Inspire Challenge Award: Farm.ink: Analysing livestock social media data for farmer chatbot
narrative: Many posts on the topic of dairy farming & livestock can be found in farming Facebook groups in sub-Saharan Africa. These posts often contain detailed reports of livestock disease and queries and comments about productivity and management concerns but they remain unanalyzed. This project combines social media and ILRI data to create an open-source platform to analyze and visualize emerging livestock disease outbreaks in Kenya, and disseminate this information through Farm.ink's chatbot service.

title: Global Agricultural Data Innovation and Acceleration Network (GARDIAN)
narrative: GARDIAN provides easy access to thousands of data assets across CGIAR to enable new analyses and enhance innovation. It will facilitate data discovery from other relevant repositories, and also allow users to upload FAIR data. This will be enabled via a workflow and standalone tools for users to enter metadata, check for personally-identifiable information, and annotated datasets with ontologies. GARDIAN will also soon enable data visualization and mapping, with pipelines for data analysis and modeling.

title: Agronomy Field Information Management System (AgroFIMS)
narrative: AgroFIMS, based on CIP’s Highly Interactive Data Analysis Platform (HiDAP) enables researchers to produce FAIR data without additional effort. AgroFIMS facilitates digital collection of semantically-annotated agronomic data, drawing fully on ontologies, particularly the Agronomy Ontology and the Crop Ontology. It allows data quality checking, statistical analysis, and generation of statistics reports, aligns a priori with CGIAR’s CG Core metadata schema, and enables easy upload to the repository of choice.

title: Inspire Challenge Award: Seeing is believing – Using smartphone camera data
narrative: Customized agricultural advice for specific crops based on local weather, soil data, pests and diseases, and input availability can improve management practices, productivity and profitability of smallholder agriculture. But personalized services do not incorporate potentially useful information on what farmers observe in their fields, such as crop color, texture and how the crop is growing. This project provides personalized agricultural advice based on localized information and visible crop characteristics derived from farmers’ own smartphone pictures.

title: Inspire Challenge Award: Real-time diagnostics for devastating wheat rust
narrative: Wheat yellow rust, caused by Puccinia striiformis f. sp. tritici (PST), is currently considered the most damaging wheat disease globally, with yield losses sometimes higher than 60%. This project aims to develop and mainstream an affordable, mobile in-field pathogenomics platform called MARPLE (Mobile And Real-time PLant disEase) to revolutionize crop pathogen surveillance and diagnostics in real time. It will rely on the MinION mobile genome sequencer platform and assess its deployment in situ in Ethiopia.

title: Inspire Challenge Award: Using IVR to connect farmers to market
narrative: The agriculture value chain in Nepal is informal and disaggregated, impeding the flow of information and resources. Farmers still rely heavily on farm gate sales, a series of middlemen, and have very little bargaining power. Farmers also face challenges finding services such as farm laborers and transportation to markets, impeding their ability to harvest and transport products to/from the market on time. Buyers face similar market barriers, constraining their operations to specific areas.

title: Inspire Challenge Award: Pest and disease monitoring by using artificial intelligence
narrative: This project aimed to increase the effectiveness of farm-level advice by leveraging three critical advances: 1) the democratization of AI thanks to open access platforms such as Google’s TensorFlow, 2) the miniaturization of technology allowing affordable deployment, and 3) the development of massive communication and money exchange platforms such as M-Pesa that allow rural extension to scale as a viable economic model enabling last mile delivery in local languages.

title: Metadata Quality Checking Tool for Dataverse Repositories
narrative: An online visualization tool  that  support data managers to check the metadata quality of their center datasets on Dataverse. It is deployed in 5 centers: AfricaRice, CIP, CIAT, Bioversity and IFPRI

title: A data ontology is a machine- and -human readable logic and description of knowledge; the team expanded a general ontology for crop knowledge which can be used to connect CGIAR data with new applications, such as decision support systems.
narrative: The Agronomy Ontology (AgrO) is currently maintained on GitHub (https://github.com/AgriculturalSemantics/agro) and available through ontology registries. AgrO is key for ensuring the interoperability of agricultural data collected in the field. AgrO provides semantics to AgroFIMS, the agronomy field management system and therefore AgrO should cover all areas needed by AgroFIMS.

title: Interactive voice response advisory service for pig farmers
narrative: The innovation uses mobile phone technology (multiple phone types and service providers).

title: Video-based agricultural extension - Integration of videos to create awareness among farmers
narrative: Research with Digital Green and the Ministry of Agriculture in Ethiopia has confirmed that the video-mediated approach is effective in increasing the uptake of the agricultural technologies and practices. Some field experiments are ongoing with implementation partners (e.g. in Cambodia and Uganda).

title: Updated social accounting matrices for Malawi and Rwanda
narrative: A social accounting matrix (SAM) is a database that represents the flows of all economic transactions that take place within an economy. SAMs are used to undertake computable general equilibrium modeling, which has informed the development of the National Agricultural Investment Plans of Malawi and Rwanda.

title: Dynamic Research EvaluAtion for Management, Python version (DREAMpy): open source software for evaluating the economic impacts of agricultural research and development projects
narrative: Software for the economic assessment of technology and returns to R&D investments. This is an updated version in Python of the older DREAM tool developed at IFPRI.

title: Tailored SMS messages to consumers for improving nutrition
narrative: Uses mobile technology to raise the health and nutritional status of children and adults in the developing world. Through business and science partnerships, this larger project called mNutrition aims to build sustainable business models for the delivery of mobile phone technology based advisory services that are effective in improving nutrition outcomes. mNutrition is a global initiative supported by the UK Department for International Development (DFID) and organised by GSMA.

title: Food safety performance tool
narrative: Tool developed to rank, compare and identify investment priorities for food safety in low- and middle-income countries (LMIC). The tool was developed to allow rapid, objective assessment of food safety system performance in LMIC. It explicitly follows a risk-based framework addressing risk assessment, risk management and risk communication.

title: SMS messages for changing farmer behavior
narrative: Innovative methods to disseminate information to pig value chain actors to increase pig growth and reproductive performance on farm, improve market access for poor value chain actors and ultimately improve food security through increased pork production.

title: Aflatoxin mitigation and control: Aflasafe MZ02 for Mozambique
narrative: Aflasafe MZ02, a biocontrol product developed for use in maize and groundnut in Mozambique/

title: Mobile phone-based surveillance system for county veterinarians and community disease reports to report and monitor livestock diseases and syndromes
narrative: Developed and implemented a mobile phone-based syndromic surveillance system for livestock diseases with an additional module for managing meat inspection records in abattoirs.

title: Map Yemen: A tool for improving of food and nutrition security in Yemen
narrative: MAP Yemen is a comprehensive online interactive database on food and nutrition security projects and related Sustainable Development Goal Indicators. The launch of MAP Yemen is considered a milestone towards more coordinated and evidence-based project and policy planning in Yemen.

title: CGIAR Core Metadata Schema version 2
narrative: CGIAR Generic metadata schema for harmonizing the description of CGIAR data sets in repositories

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe BF01 product for Burkina Faso and potentially 10 other countires in the Sahel
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe product GH01 and GH02 for Ghana
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe product for Nigeria
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe product ZM01 and ZM02 for Zambia
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe product TZ01 and TZ02 for Tanzania
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe MWMZ01 product for Malawi and Mozambique
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Aflasafe MW02 for Malawi
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: [updated from 2017] Stories of Change approach
narrative: Stories of Change is a structured case study approach which systematically assesses and analyzes drivers of nutritional change in specific country contexts. These resulting ‘stories’ improve our understanding of what drives impact in reducing undernutrition, and how enabling environments and pro-nutrition policy and implementation processes can be cultivated and sustained.

title: [updated and corrected from 2017] WEAI (Women's Empowerment in Agriculture Index)
narrative: The WEAI is the first comprehensive and standardized measure to directly measure women’s empowerment and inclusion in the agricultural sector. The WEAI is an innovative tool composed of two sub-indices: one measures women’s empowerment across five domains in agriculture, and the other measures gender parity in empowerment within the household.

title: Fecal Sludge Management Business Model Tool
narrative: The planning toolkit has tools that can assist you with stakeholder engagement, infrastructure planning and selection of business models.

title: Risk mapping for pig endemic diseases in Vietnam
narrative: Mapping past outbreak data to inform policies for disease control, here developed using the example of porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome (PRRS) in pigs in Vietnam.

title: Online tick database for Tunisia
narrative: An online tool combining all available data on tick distribution in Tunisia

title: Community based gastrointestinal parasite control in small ruminants in Ethiopia
narrative: Instead of advocating for farmer level training and parasite control, this approach tackles the problem at community level leading to quicker impact. We tested the method and produced a training module for vets/paravets on community based gastrointestinal parasite control in small ruminants, which they can use to train farmers.

title: Post-mortem training module for vets in Ethiopia
narrative: Instead of relying on serology, this module highlights the advantages of conducting field post-mortem as a cost-effective diagnostic tool.

title: Training module for vets/paravets on coenurosis control in small ruminants in Ethiopia
narrative: Coenurosis is better controlled at community level and requires long-term commitment of farmers, vets and extension agents, thus a community approach was found better suited to combat this production disease with high impact.

title: Mobile veterinary service delivery model for pastoral systems in Kenya
narrative: A new model to deliver animal health services to hard to reach pastoral areas - a mobile veterinary clinic by private sector through high livestock concentrations such as watering points to try and improve access to animal health services.
evidence_link: http://isvee.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/ISVEE15_Abstract-BOOK.pdf (Abstract is poster presentation on p647 in the abstract book); https://cgiar.sharepoint.com/:p:/r/sites/livestock/Shared%20Documents/Annual%20Reports/2018%20Annual%20Report/Evidence%20(Deliverables%202018)/I751_I752%20Animal%20Health%20Delivery%20Models%20Poster.ppt?d=wf146e9a68bb14991ad299e2ced9bd92f&csf=1&e=cuerO2

title: Public Private Partnerships for veterinary service delivery in Kenya
narrative: The objective of this approach was to reduce the unit cost of services, which is high in extensive livestock systems.  It was a partnership between the government and the private sector. When the government goes for vaccination campaigns they just vaccinate against one or at most two diseases. The private sector can provide additional services (treatments, deworming, tick control, vaccines) at the same time and share some costs with the government.

title: A new version of the Africa Tree Finder
narrative:
This easy-to-use App shows you data on the distribution of indigenous tree species in different natural vegetation types, combined with information on the products and services that the tree species can provide. It arms you – local community members, government agencies, private sector owners, and other land managers – with the information you need to select the best tree species for your landscape restoration or agroforestry effort. 
The Africa Tree Finder can tell you which trees are best suited to meet the demand for wood-based products, human consumption, animals, and environmental services. It can also tell you the local names of species and provides vital information on propagation and seed treatment, storage and management.

As a complement to the conceptual framework, a simulation software (www.shadeemotion.net) was prepared to explore how shade canopy trees provide the right levels of shade to the understory crop and help agronomy to decide on the interventions needed to adjust shade canopy design to both the objectives of the farmers and the need and tolerance to shade of the main crops in the understory.

strategies such as crop and livestock keeping.

title: PIM research showing the economic benefits of community forest concessions makes the case for continued community stewardship of 400,000 hectares of tropical forests in Guatemala
narrative: PIM research highlighted the socioeconomic benefits of 12 community forest concessions in the Maya Biosphere Reserve in Petén, Guatemala. These findings make a strong case for continued community stewardship of 400,000 ha of tropical forests.

title: Chaya (native plant known as tree spinach) introduced in school feeding programme in Chiquimula, Guatemala
narrative: In 2017, the government of Guatemala approved a School Feeding Law to provide a healthier and more nutritious diet to students between 6 and 12 years of age in public schools. Bioversity International in coordination with Mancomunidad Copan Chorti proposed the native plant known as chaya as an ingredient for the school feeding program. Information provided included chaya's nutritional value, its ease of production, low cost, local availability and different recipes for cooking it.

title: Agriculture, Nutrition, and Health (ANH) Academy and ANH Academy Week Conference provide a unique, interdisciplinary conference and community to engage stakeholders around ANH
narrative: The Agriculture, Nutrition, and Health Academy Week fills a previously unmet need to convene people around agriculture, nutrition, and health (ANH) challenges. These researchers, practitioners and policymakers are becoming a collaborative global community of researchers and research users, with expertise and motivation to harness agriculture to reduce all forms of malnutrition and mitigate any negative health consequences. Dissemination of methods, metrics, and tools is accelerated through the ANH Academy community and annual conference.

title: Ten Krishi Vigyan Kendras (agriculture extension offices) in two Indian States are setting up Farming System for Nutrition (FSN) models
narrative: The approach introduced agricultural remedies to the nutritional maladies prevailing in an area through mainstreaming nutritional criteria in the selection of the components of a farming system involving crops, nutrition garden of fruits and vegetables and animal husbandry components like poultry or fishery, accompanied by nutrition awareness.

title: New Varieties adopted: Mayi Plus  II
narrative: CIMMYT maize yield trials have identified two varieties that out-yield anything grown in Haiti in both irrigated and rain-fed conditions.  Basically, CIMMYT has identified the best varieties for the next decade in Haiti.

title: National guidelines for agri-nutrition community messaging in Kenya
narrative: AVCD nutrition work has supported the development of new national agri-nutrition guidelines for community messaging in Kenya.  The Government of Kenya contributed and their logo is on the cards.

title: Sustainable Landscapes Rating Tool (SLRT)
narrative: SLRT enables a rapid assessment of the key conditions for jurisdictional policies and governance that enable sustainable landscapes. The tool provides a snapshot of a jurisdiction’s capacity to establish and ensure effective functioning of policies, plans, strategies, regulations, monitoring systems and multi-stakeholder platforms, which, collectively, have been found to be important in supporting sustainable landscapes. Ratings (A, B, C) are given to various indicators that are validated by multiple stakeholders. Later information is made available to interested stakeholders (i.e. investors/donors), and allows such stakeholders to gauge the potential risk of investment in a state or region, through a relatively straightforward scorecard.

title: Development of robust and highly skilled forecasts capabilitites of dynamical models used to simulate crop performance in the Colombian agricultural context
narrative: We evaluated multiple approaches to developing robust and highly skilled forecasts of dynamical models in the Colombian context and with the leadership from FEDEARROZ, on the assessment of WRF model was implemented in their servers. Strong ties with UK-Met-Office. The WRF that is implemented as part of the CSRD-Colombia effort.

title: ‘Contour bunding’ preserves soils and boosts farmers’ incomes by 20% in Mali – new study
narrative: In Mali  contour bunding technique retained moisture and nutrients while preventing soil erosion also brings as much as 20% increase in net income. The technology reduces water runoff and controls soil erosion through ridges covered with perennial grasses such as Andropogon and Vetiver. Farmers use the ridges for crop production.

title: Science-informed large-scale routine public investment (business model) to promote the "Happy seeder"technology for in-situ management of crop residues aiming  to curb air pollution and build resilience
narrative: To maximise impact, the innovation is inter-connected& coherent reflecting the priorities of the national economy. Supports culturing socio-economic-environmental development wherein collaborators bringing their comparative advantages to strengthen science of scaling for accelerated uptake of happyseeder via models favouring sustainable development with policy oriented towards leveraging technology base for site-specific use.

title: Iron Beans: INTA BIODOR (SMR 88)
narrative: New variety of iron beans.  As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Monitoring and Evaluation of Land in Africa (MELA) framework: This framework contains a set of indicators for countries to track their progress towards meeting the objectives of the African Heads of State declaration on land issues.
narrative: The MELA framework is being piloted by 12 countries in Africa.  This allows tracking of progress on commitments made under the AU Declaration on Land Governance in Africa, including commitments to land rights for women and special groups, e.g. pastoralists.

title: Multi-level ICT-based Smart Monitoring system to track implementation, performance,  perceived efficiency of Climate -smart Agricultural Practices and technologies at farm and household level including their effects on food and livelihoods  security.
narrative:
This novel ICT-based instrument allows to track performance and outcomes of CSA options across multiple levels, providing sound metrics to address:
- synergies and trade-offs at plot level, 
- effects on Food/Livelihood Security, Adaptation  and Gender dimensions at household level, 
- and adoption enablers and constraints at community level.

narrative: Digital platform for scaled on-farm farmer-participatory evaluations of agricultural technologies

title: Mobile data entry for manual data
narrative: We developed Google Forms based online data entry app that our field assistants have been using to provide manually measured daily discharge data. Previously manual data was only available after 4-6 months because data was only recorded in data registers that had to be transported to and transcribed in Kathmandu.

title: A new global data set on farm size distribution by country
narrative: As part of a study on "Farming and the geography of nutrient production for human use: a transdisciplinary analysis", we developed a new set of global datasets on production of vitamin A, vitamin B₁₂, folate, iron, zinc, calcium, calories, and protein, and the relative contribution of farms of different sizes

title: Designing low cost water haresting system for Bundelkhand region and rejuvinating Haveli system
narrative: To over come water scarcity situation of Bundelkhand, traditional water harvesting system called as “haveli system” need to be rejuvenated. A huge earthen bund to be constructed across the stream to join two adjacent hillocks/stream network to impound water during the monsoon

title: Voice calls for remote data collection
narrative: ICRAF with WFP and LSHTM evaluated the use of using voice calls over mobile phones to collect data remotely. This innovation reduces the costs of data collection and allows monitoring in difficult to access areas. We tested this on nutrition indicators, it is adaptable to others.

title: Silvopastoral systems for degrading lands in the Colombian Amazon
narrative: A silvopastoral system conventional model was modified to suit particular farm characteristics. As a result the conventional silvopastoral systems, with high tree density, existing pastures, and non-native species, was modified by a system that includes native and alien species, improved pastures, trees dispersed or in barriers and short cycle crops.

title: AloWeather - ICT tool for delivering agroadvisory service to farmers
narrative: Aloweather is a fee-based technical solution that provides locally-relevant, accessible, and actionable weather forecasts and advisories through SMS and voice message interactions. Voice response message from users will improve the concept. Currently, farmers will subscribe to the service and pay for it, however other solutions are possible.

title: Systems modelling (whole farm) as decision support evaluating impact of SLM strategies of household cashflows
narrative: Whole-farm  stochastic modelling approach  allowed us to analyze  trade-offs  and outcomes associated with potential farm systems change on simulated farms with varied cropping systems in each of the five selected districts. It provides us contrasting outcomes  in terms of farm household’s cash flows considering modern inputs, labour and market price.

title: Characterization of farms in terms of proximity to the natural state and in terms of their contribution to landscape connectivity
narrative: To achieve this goal, a series of field studies have been carried out by surveying several aspects such as biodiversity, agricultural practices, environmental quality and  cultural aspects. The outcome of this study will be a classification of farms that contribute more to structural landscape connectivity.

narrative: To promote stakeholder engagement in research and outreach, the project adopted a multi-scalar approach centered on the creation of science-policy dialogue platforms at sub-national (district) levels. narrative: IFPRI, ICRAF, and partners tested whether experimental games, usually used to measure collective action, can contribute to improved governance of shared resources. title: Assessment of the potential of Large Field Models (aiming to increase the efficiency of rice production and the quality of rice) to offer an opportunity to apply CSA principles and reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions

title: Innovative underground storage for mitigating water disasters and building climate resilience
narrative: A new innovation (UTFI) has been developed that converts water-related disasters into rural livelihood opportunities that enhances community resilience. Piloting has been successful and influenced policy in India with plans for next-level scaling-up. The solution has just been recognized by the UN in World Water Development Report for 2018.

title: Measuring farmer preferences on risk and ambiguity using direct elicitation and behavioral games in a large sample to explore effects on agricultural technology adoption
narrative: We collected endline data on risk and ambiguity aversion for the sample that comprised the census for the study. This is a sample of over 13,000 households and is the largest every collection of such data, which will be used to analyze how risk and ambiguity preferences affect technology adoption.

title: Approaches to screen and treat maternal depression through group therapy to improve newborn child outcomes in Ethiopia
narrative: This approach screens new mothers for depression and offers treatment through interpersonal therapy in groups (IPT-G).  Maternal post-partum depression is associated with poorer child outcomes and IPT-G can alleviate depression symptom.  This study will test whether cash transfers boost effectiveness of IPT-G for improving child outcomes in Ethiopia.

title: New lessons on design of social protection programming to reduce intimate partner violence
narrative: Studies in Ecuador, Bangladesh, and Mali show how design features (e.g., transfer modality, complementary programming) and context (e.g., household structure) shape the magnitude and sustainability of cash transfer programs’ effects on IPV. New work in Ethiopia will explore how adding treatment of maternal depression to social protection programming affects IPV.

title: Innovative strategies to improve resilience for the poor in fragile and low-income settings
narrative: Studies in Mali and Yemen assess the effectiveness of social protection programs in fragile and low-income settings, particularly conflict-affected areas, through opportunistic data collection in regions where conflict broke out while research was ongoing. New work in Ethiopia explicitly tests alternative strategies to reach the poor in a fragile setting.

title: Smartphone technology to introduce affordable high-quality crop insurance
